**Backend developer test**

### PHP Task 1

_The php programming task will be in the form of a REST API with internal functionality and functionality which is to be obtained via API from other external services._ _ **You may implement any architecture you desire in this solution, keep in mind that the solution you develop should be easily extendable, maintainable, robust and scalable.** _

_Kindly make use of PHP7, should you decide to make use of packages kindly use composer for package management._

##### Endpoint 1

Build a REST API endpoint which accepts two parameters as an input. This endpoint should be reachable via /most\_words from the application root.

**The parameter names should be as follows:**

1. _sentence_ - [string] sentence containing any number of words and can be in any language.
2. _output\_language_ - [string] identifier for the language to translate to
3. _max\_characters_ - [integer] maximum number of characters

**The endpoint should do the following:**

Using the Google Cloud API _(_ [_https://cloud.google.com/translate/docs/reference/rest_](https://cloud.google.com/translate/docs/reference/rest)_)_ detect the input language and translate it into the language defined in the  _output\_language_ parameter.

Once this has been done take the translated sentence and re-arrange it to have as many words in it as possible in any order as long as the total amount characters in the final string is less than or equal to the _max\_characters_ parameter.  This result will be the _final\_string_ response field.

Once this is done use Google Cloud API to re-translate the _final\_string_back into the original language and pass it as _final\_string\_translated_.

**The response should contain the following fields:**

1. _original\_sentence_ - [string]
2. _final\_string_ - [string]
3. _final\_string\_translated_ - [string]
4. _duration\_ms_ [integer]

**Cloud API Credentials:**

Key: AIzaSyCWf-Hl9zC0FdmLpJShaXPCUgK8UbighfQ

##### Endpoint 2

Build a REST API endpoint which accepts two parameters as an input. This endpoint should be reachable via /best\_strategy from the application root.

**The parameter names should be as follows:**

1. _game\_state_ - [array] an array containing an even number of (int, float) values representing the initial game state

**Game rules:**

The game is played between two people in alternating turns. Both players are always able to &#39;see&#39; the values of the array and you start first.

At each turn the person playing needs to pick one number from the _game\_state_ array by choosing from either the element at _game\_state_[0] or _game\_state_[n-1] _(in other words either the first or last element).

Whichever option is chosen, the player playing the round gets to remove the element from the array and add its value to their score. Then the next player makes a move and makes their choice. The game progresses until the array is empty. The player with the highest score wins.

Keep in mind that the best choice may not always be the one which is picking the highest value available, your choice also effects the available options for your opponent.

**The endpoint should do the following:**

Run a simulation to determine the best strategy to win this game.  Your opponent will also try and make the best moves they can, so factor this into the strategy.

**The response should contain the following fields:**

1. _strategy_ - [array] steps for the ideal starategy with at least the following information:
  1. _direction choice (left,right)_
  2. _value (3.5,2,etc.)_
2. _duration\_ms_ [integer]

### PHP Task 2

Add logging to your application. This should be implemented on each endpoint you have created. The logging should record the following details:

1. IP Address making the request
2. Date and Time of the request
3. Input parameters
4. Response parameters

The logging should be written to a folder in the root of you application in the form of text files.

### PHP Task 3

Unit test your REST API using PHP unit in as much detail as you see fit.

### PHP Task 4

Create technical documentation helping others understand how your new API should be used and how it should/can be extended. This can be done in as much detail as you see fit.

### JavaScript Task 1 (Konami cheat code)

Using vanilla JavaScript, build a script which can detect the insertion of a cheat code on a web page. The cheat code will be inputted via the keyboard and will be as follows:

 ![](data:image/*;base64,)

After each keystroke, a maximum of 500ms can elapse before the entire sequence needs to be inputted again from scratch.

If a mistake is made then a period of 1000ms must elapse before the cheat code can be re-attempted.

Once the cheat code is correctly inserted an alert should be prompted letting the user know the cheat code was triggered successfully.
